concept_data.title: United Nations Centre for Regional Development

summary: The "UN Centre for Regional Development," a concept under the category of the United Nations, serves as a pivotal institution in promoting sustainable regional development globally. Within the context of EU legal and regulatory frameworks, this Centre facilitates collaboration between member states and the UN, aligning regional policies with international development goals. As a redirect to the preferred term "UN Centre for Regional Development," it underscores the Centre's role in enhancing regional governance and policy coherence. The Centre's initiatives contribute to the EU's commitment to sustainable development, fostering synergies between local, national, and international regulatory efforts.
